Claim: A new alcohol-free sanitizer has been developed by the Dedan Kimathi University in Kenya.
Explaination: The hand sanitizer developed by the Dedan Kimathi University actually contains alcohol.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A new alcohol-free sanitizer has been developed by the Dedan Kimathi University in Kenya.

Explanation:The hand sanitizer developed by the Dedan Kimathi University actually contains alcohol.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-new-alcohol-free-hand-sanitizer-actually-contains-60-alcohol-2f31d4d41b12?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: “COVID-19 started because we eat animals.”
Explaination: Scientists think COVID-19 originated in bats and then jumped to another animal host, possibly pangolins, before spreading to humans. As of now, there is no evidence that eating meat is the source of the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “COVID-19 started because we eat animals.”

Explanation:Scientists think COVID-19 originated in bats and then jumped to another animal host, possibly pangolins, before spreading to humans. As of now, there is no evidence that eating meat is the source of the coronavirus outbreak.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/18/instagram-posts/vegan-instagram-accounts-spread-misinformation-abo/

Claim: Manir Hossain, a 23-year-old man from India’s Tripura, died in a hospital in Malaysia due to the new coronavirus.
Explaination: Upon our investigation, we found the above news reports to be False. An Indian citizen from Tripura did not die due to coronavirus in Malaysia. The reason for his death is Status Epilepticus Secondary Meningoencephalitis.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Manir Hossain, a 23-year-old man from India’s Tripura, died in a hospital in Malaysia due to the new coronavirus.

Explanation:Upon our investigation, we found the above news reports to be False. An Indian citizen from Tripura did not die due to coronavirus in Malaysia. The reason for his death is Status Epilepticus Secondary Meningoencephalitis.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/02/05/fact-check-indian-citizen-from-tripura-did-not-die-due-to-coronavirus-in-malaysia/

Claim: If Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for coronavirus.
Explaination: Buckingham Palace gave statement confirming she was in good health.
Label: False
html:
Claim: If Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for coronavirus.

Explanation:Buckingham Palace gave statement confirming she was in good health.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-queen-elizabeth-ii-did-not-test-positive-for-coronavirus.html

Claim: Doctors are giving out “rescue packs” for people with pre-existing respiratory conditions.
Explaination: There is no evidence that doctors in Ireland are giving out packs containing steroids and antibiotics to people with pre-existing respiratory conditions, such as asthma or COPD. On the contrary, doctors have advised that such a move would not be safe, given the different needs that each patient would have.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Doctors are giving out “rescue packs” for people with pre-existing respiratory conditions.

Explanation:There is no evidence that doctors in Ireland are giving out packs containing steroids and antibiotics to people with pre-existing respiratory conditions, such as asthma or COPD. On the contrary, doctors have advised that such a move would not be safe, given the different needs that each patient would have.

https://www.thejournal.ie/rescue-pack-asthma-5057255-Mar2020/

Claim: Claim that disease outbreaks and pandemics correspond with election years.
Explaination: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found no correlation between election years and virus outbreaks. The outbreaks of SARS, Bird Flu and COVID-19 do not line up with the dates claimed in the post. In the case of Zika virus, the disease has had multiple outbreaks since 2014 in parts of Oceania and in Brazil. Bird Flu, MERS and Ebola have not been reported in Australia and have not been a significant feature of local political discussion or debate. Considering overseas elections, such as US presidential elections, there is also no consistent pattern of outbreaks occurring in election years.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Claim that disease outbreaks and pandemics correspond with election years.

Explanation:Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found no correlation between election years and virus outbreaks. The outbreaks of SARS, Bird Flu and COVID-19 do not line up with the dates claimed in the post. In the case of Zika virus, the disease has had multiple outbreaks since 2014 in parts of Oceania and in Brazil. Bird Flu, MERS and Ebola have not been reported in Australia and have not been a significant feature of local political discussion or debate. Considering overseas elections, such as US presidential elections, there is also no consistent pattern of outbreaks occurring in election years.

https://www.aap.com.au/no-vote-of-confidence-for-claims-linking-pandemics-with-election-years/

Claim: Russia released 500 lions to ensure people would stay inside houses.
Explaination: This photo was is from 2016, South Africa, part of a movie production.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Russia released 500 lions to ensure people would stay inside houses.

Explanation:This photo was is from 2016, South Africa, part of a movie production.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/tamil/fact-check-russia-released-500-lions-to-stay-people-at-home/

Claim: Saint Luke’s Hospital of the USA says consuming alcohol can reduce the risk of COVID-19.
Explaination: Saint Luke's Hospital hasn't released any such advisory.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Saint Luke’s Hospital of the USA says consuming alcohol can reduce the risk of COVID-19.

Explanation:Saint Luke's Hospital hasn't released any such advisory.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/coronavirus-fact-check-claims-on-alcohol-and-covid-19-1654812-2020-03-12

Claim: The viral video claims to show the visuals of China police personnel trying to control the patients allegedly suffering from the pandemic.
Explaination: The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak and is related to police storming the metro in the wake of Hong Kong protests.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: The viral video claims to show the visuals of China police personnel trying to control the patients allegedly suffering from the pandemic.

Explanation:The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak and is related to police storming the metro in the wake of Hong Kong protests.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15267158

Claim: A couple of videos shared this month on Facebook purportedly show recent lootings in shops in South Africa, while the country undergoes a 21-day lockdown to minimize the spread of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: However, both videos show footage of earlier looting incidents and were already circulating online last year.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A couple of videos shared this month on Facebook purportedly show recent lootings in shops in South Africa, while the country undergoes a 21-day lockdown to minimize the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:However, both videos show footage of earlier looting incidents and were already circulating online last year.

https://factcheck.afp.com/no-these-videos-do-not-show-recent-looting-south-africa

Claim: The UN is providing food aid to South American countries due to the coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The UN office at Colombia has warned that a WhatsApp hoax claiming the UN would be providing food aid is false. A version of the same hoax was debunked by the UN office at Paraguay.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The UN is providing food aid to South American countries due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The UN office at Colombia has warned that a WhatsApp hoax claiming the UN would be providing food aid is false. A version of the same hoax was debunked by the UN office at Paraguay.

https://elsurti.com/coronavirus-falso-onu-ayuda/

Claim: The WHO confirmed 50 new cases in Guayaquil, Ecuador, on 2/2/20.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: The WHO confirmed 50 new cases in Guayaquil, Ecuador, on 2/2/20.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/?check=2

Claim: Cattle vaccine is related to COVID-19, the current panic overblown by media.
Explaination: The viral post claims that the world has been using coronavirus vaccine on cattle for years and the current panic on novel coronavirus (COVID-19) has been overblown by media. When we investigated, we found that the vaccine being referred is for cattle, it is neither related with humans, not with COVID-19. The viral post is misleading.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Cattle vaccine is related to COVID-19, the current panic overblown by media.

Explanation:The viral post claims that the world has been using coronavirus vaccine on cattle for years and the current panic on novel coronavirus (COVID-19) has been overblown by media. When we investigated, we found that the vaccine being referred is for cattle, it is neither related with humans, not with COVID-19. The viral post is misleading.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-cattle-vaccine-not-related-to-covid-19-misleading-post-getting-viral/

Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.
Explaination: Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.
Label: False
html:
Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.

Explanation:Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-15.html

Claim: George Soros is one of the people responsible for the new coronavirus, born in a laboratory.
Explaination: There is no scientific evidence that the new coronavirus was made in a laboratory. A study published in “Nature” says that the virus came from an animal that infected a human being.
Label: False
html:
Claim: George Soros is one of the people responsible for the new coronavirus, born in a laboratory.

Explanation:There is no scientific evidence that the new coronavirus was made in a laboratory. A study published in “Nature” says that the virus came from an animal that infected a human being.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-george-soros-e-acionista-de-laboratorio-em-wuhan-e-esta-por-detras-do-novo-coronavirus/

Claim: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, “We have lost control, we have killed the epidemic physically and mentally. Can’t understand what more we can do, all solutions are exhausted on ground. Our only hope remains up in the sky. God, rescue your people.”
Explaination: The quote attributed to Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte is fabricated. The image accompanying the post shows the president of Brazil, not the Italian prime minister.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, “We have lost control, we have killed the epidemic physically and mentally. Can’t understand what more we can do, all solutions are exhausted on ground. Our only hope remains up in the sky. God, rescue your people.”

Explanation:The quote attributed to Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte is fabricated. The image accompanying the post shows the president of Brazil, not the Italian prime minister.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/01/facebook-posts/fabricated-quote-falsely-attributed-italian-prime-/

Claim: Says 80% of novel coronavirus cases are “mild.”
Explaination: The website Information is Beautiful published a chart showing that 80.9% of novel coronavirus cases are "mild." But reports from the World Health Organization and the U.S. CDC found that mild cases account for 75-to-80% of all cases.
Label: MOSTLY TRUE
html:
Claim: Says 80% of novel coronavirus cases are “mild.”

Explanation:The website Information is Beautiful published a chart showing that 80.9% of novel coronavirus cases are "mild." But reports from the World Health Organization and the U.S. CDC found that mild cases account for 75-to-80% of all cases.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/13/viral-image/are-80-percent-coronavirus-cases-mild/

Claim: The coronavirus is “a military bio-weapon developed by China’s Army.”
Explaination: There is no evidence that the Chinese military developed the 2019 coronavirus as a bioweapon.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The coronavirus is “a military bio-weapon developed by China’s Army.”

Explanation:There is no evidence that the Chinese military developed the 2019 coronavirus as a bioweapon.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/11/hal-turner-radio-show/far-right-radio-host-hal-turner-promotes-unproven-/

Claim: Chicken infected from coronavirus found In Bangalore.
Explaination: Post claiming chicken infected from coronavirus found in Bangalore is fake. The image is old and is not related to 2019 novel coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chicken infected from coronavirus found In Bangalore.

Explanation:Post claiming chicken infected from coronavirus found in Bangalore is fake. The image is old and is not related to 2019 novel coronavirus.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-post-claiming-chicken-infected-from-coronavirus-found-in-bangalore-is-fake/

Claim: The Umbrella Corporation, from the video game Resident Evil, is linked to the Chinese company RLSW.
Explaination: The Chinese company RLSW is engaged in genetic testing and advanced scientific research. However, the address on Google Maps could not be corroborated and the official site does not offer much information.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: The Umbrella Corporation, from the video game Resident Evil, is linked to the Chinese company RLSW.

Explanation:The Chinese company RLSW is engaged in genetic testing and advanced scientific research. However, the address on Google Maps could not be corroborated and the official site does not offer much information.

https://spondeomedia.com/realidad-o-ficcion-una-umbrella-corporation-real-en-china/

Claim: A picture showing dead Italian doctors in an operating theater after succumbing to COVID-19.
Explaination: The picture showing doctors on the floor of an operating room is actually from an episode of Grey's Anatomy.

Claim: The United States of America threatened Iraq with coronavirus in 1990.
Explaination: According to the AP Archive description, Saddam Hussein said, “If God wills it and we have to run after the enemy, then we will do it.” Also, in AP’s description, we found that Saddam Hussein did not refer to the word ‘Coronavirus’ in the original video.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The United States of America threatened Iraq with coronavirus in 1990.

Explanation:According to the AP Archive description, Saddam Hussein said, “If God wills it and we have to run after the enemy, then we will do it.” Also, in AP’s description, we found that Saddam Hussein did not refer to the word ‘Coronavirus’ in the original video.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15296317

Claim: A fake quote of Vice President Leni Robredo suggesting to “inhale cough back” to prevent the spread of the 2019 novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The Vice President did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. News5 said the graphic was edited using their template.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A fake quote of Vice President Leni Robredo suggesting to “inhale cough back” to prevent the spread of the 2019 novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The Vice President did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. News5 said the graphic was edited using their template.

Claim: Cattle vaccine is related to COVID-19, the current panic overblown by media.
Explaination: The viral post claims that the world has been using coronavirus vaccine on cattle for years and the current panic on novel coronavirus (COVID-19) has been overblown by media. When we investigated, we found that the vaccine being referred is for cattle, it is neither related with humans, not with COVID-19. The viral post is misleading.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Cattle vaccine is related to COVID-19, the current panic overblown by media.

Explanation:The viral post claims that the world has been using coronavirus vaccine on cattle for years and the current panic on novel coronavirus (COVID-19) has been overblown by media. When we investigated, we found that the vaccine being referred is for cattle, it is neither related with humans, not with COVID-19. The viral post is misleading.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-cattle-vaccine-not-related-to-covid-19-misleading-post-getting-viral/
